RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Histria da Arte, Filosofia e Estudos Germnicos - Ruprecht-Karls-Universitt Heidelberg (1995), com estgios na Universit degli Studi di Roma La Sapienza (1995), University of Cambridge (1995), mestrado em Histria da Arte e Filosofia - Technische Universitt Berlin (1995) e doutorado em Histria da Arte - Technische Universitt Berlin (2002). Atualmente professor colaborador da Universidade Federal de So Paulo, pesquisador principal - European Research Council, pesquisador - Swiss National Science Foundation, pesquisador principal - Swiss National Science Foundation e professor titular - University of Zurich. Tem experincia na rea de Histria da Arte, com nfase na Histria da Arte da Primeira Idade Moderna: Renascimento e Barroco.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Tristan Weddigen is full professor for the history early modern art at the University of Zurich and visiting professor at Unifesp. Previously, he has taught at the School of Art and Design Lucerne, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Zurich, the Universities of Bern and Lausanne. He has received his M. A. and Ph. D. from the Technical University Berlin, published as "Raffaels Papageienzimmer", and his habilitation from the University of Bern with a study on the Dresden Picture Gallery in the 18th and early 19th centuries. He has been Getty Scholar at The Getty Research Institute and is co-director of theproject "New Art Histories" in collaboration with Unifesp, funded by the Getty Foundation. He is currently also principal investigator of the research project "An Iconology of the Textile Medium in Art and Architecture", funded by the European Research Council and president of the Executive Master in Art Market Studies at the University of Zurich.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Imagem, Cidade e Contemporaneidade. Programa de Ps-Graduao em Histria da Arte
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Estuda a Imagem, a partir da histria das manifestaes artsticas, seus sujeitos e instituies, pelo vis da crtica de arte, do cinema e da arquitetura da cidade. D nfase ?imagem social? tal qual ela aparece na arte e seus circuitos institucionais, na cultura de massa e na produo social da cidade, enquanto paisagem realizada e imaginada, na qual se inserem prticas artsticas, polticas e culturais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: An Iconology of the Textile in Art and Architecture (Uma Iconologia do Txtil na Arte e na Arquitetura)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto investiga os significados histricos, funes e teorias do mdium txtil na arte e na arquitetura desde a Idade Mdia aos dias atuais. A explorao desta mdia artistica especfica deve resultar numa teoria histrica do txtil em sua performatividade artstica. A noo tradicional de iconologia, a qual atualmente implcita numa reavaliao dentro de disciplinas hermeneuticamente orientadas de pesquisa da imagem o ponto de partida metodolgico. O projeto est focado nos discursos dos txteis num campo de pesquisa situado entre a histria da arte e da arquitetura e estudos culturais e visuais, envolvendo tambm outras disciplinas tais como estudos literrios e histria social. Alm disso, preocupa-se em conectar duas culturas cientficas: da universidade e dos museus, numa abordagem terica acompanhada por estudos de objetos txteis concretos. Isso tambm requer especializao transdisciplinar da arte contempornea. O projeto trata de temas de arte interconectados como mdia txtil, pintura, escultura, construo de espaos, txteis sagrados, tapearias e instalaes.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: New Art Histories: Relating Ideas, Objects and Institutions in the Latin American World - O projeto Novas Histrias da Arte: Relatando ideias, objetos e Instituies no Mundo Latinoamericano contribui para o debate internacional nos s
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto Novas Histrias da Arte: Relatando ideias, objetos e Instituies no Mundo Latinoamericano contribui para o debate internacional nos seguintes termos: ?discutindo identidades passadas, presentes e futuras da emergncia da disciplina de Histria da Arte no mundo latinoamericano. ?Promovendo um debate internacional sobre a histria da arte no mundo global, contectando pessoas e instituies na Amrica Latina fora dela. ?Focando relaes entre ideias, objetos e instituies como agentes histricos e contemporneos para um intercmbio global da disciplina. ?Implementando estas discusses em prticas em conjuno com a recente implantao de um dos mais amplos departamentos de histria da arte na Amrica Latina (junto UNIFESP)

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Principal Investigator of the SNFS research project An Iconology of the Textile in Art and Architecture Principal Pesquisador do Fundao Nacional Sua de Cincias no Projeto de Iconologia da Arte Txtil e Arquitetura
Project Constructing Identity: Visual, Spatial, and Literary Cultures in Lombardy, 14th to 16th Centuries

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Principal Investigator of the SNFS research project An Iconology of the Textile in Art and Architecture
Projeto de Pesquisa sobre Iconologia em Arte Txtil e Arquitetura
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The fabrication of textiles is one of the oldest and foundational cultural technologies. The objective of the interdisciplinary research project is to investigate the historical meanings, functions and theories of the textile medium in art and architecture from the Middle Ages to the present. The exploration of this specific artistic medium should result in a historical theory of the textile in its artistic performativity. The traditional notion of iconology, which is currently undergoing a reevaluation within the hermeneutically oriented disciplines of image research, is the methodological point of departure. The project focused on the textile discourse engages in a field of research situated between art and architectural history and within cultural and visual studies, involving also other disciplines such as literary studies and social history. Moreover, it aims at connecting the two scientific cultures of the university and the museum, as the theoretical approach is accompanied by studies of concrete textile objects. It also draws transdisciplinary expertise from contemporary art. The project deals with interconnected subject areas such as textile media of painting and sculpture, constructions of space, sacred textiles, tapestries, and installation art. Other fields of research are the myths of the origins of the textile, questions of representation, relations between textuality and narrativity, transmediality, modernity and the assumed femininity of the textile arts. This cross-disciplinary perspective requires a variety of instrumental methods ranging from iconography to anthropological approaches, and from gender studies to textual analysis. One Principal Investigator and several Doctoral and Postdoctoral Researchers aim to performing basic research in an innovative and contemporary field, in order to contribute to the establishment of the history of textile art as an academic discipline and to the advancement of art and architectural history towards a genera
